result.execSummary:
The defendant Laderrius D Watts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. Anger management counseling. No violent contact with the victim. Do not drive unless properly licensed.
Conditions same as outlined in Ct 2.
Conditions same as outlined in Ct 2.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laderrius D Watts

records.addlTxt:
9:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Laderrius D Watts in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Laderrius D Watts. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Cts 2 & 3- GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: Cts 2 & 3 GUILTY with Ct 1 being dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Victim gives statement. 

BTC: 
Sentence withheld. 
9 months probation.

Conditions of probation:
30 days conditional time STAYED
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored accordingly. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
Anger management. 
No violent contact with the victim.
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge + Domestic Abuse Assessments
to defense to obtain copies of certain evidence

records.addlTxt: Status conference on April 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim N.H (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

*Amended 02/23/22* Defendant may have non violent contact with the victim N.H***

10:26 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Laderrius D Watts appeared in court, Attorney Christopher Scott Carson appeared in court for Laderrius D Watts. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Victim is present, state is in compliance with Marcys Law.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense indicates the victim is requesting no violent contact with the defendant.
State indicates the victim has one to the womans resource center and sent a letter requesting the contact.
Victim speaks in regards to the request.
BTC: Motion to modify bond to allow non violent contact between the victim and defendant.
